main event: A ground-radar observation of an unidentified aerial object in New Carlisle, Ohio, on 12 September 1957, traveling at an estimated 2,000 MPH and 2,500 ft. altitude, with a saucer-like shape. The conclusion drawn was 'Insufficient Data'.
interesting points: The object was first picked up on radar and moved across the horizon at a rapid speed of 2,000 MPH, indicating high velocity and agility.
The observer believed the object to be 'out of this world' due to its saucer-like shape and incredible speed.
The sighting occurred on a clear day in bright daylight with few clouds, enhancing visibility.
The witness was a 35-year-old male welder with technical school electronic training, adding credibility to the report.
The report included a detailed survey form with questions about the observer's location, conditions, and experience during the sighting.
sighted object: Unidentified aerial object with a saucer-like shape
witnesses: Single witness, a 35-year-old male with technical training
photographs: No photographs available in the report
